metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15132 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
Zabbix through 4.4.0alpha1 allows User Enumeration. With login requests, itis possible to enumerate application usernames based on the variability ofserver responses (e.g., the "Login name or password is incorrect" and "Nopermissions for system access" messages, or just blocking for a number ofseconds). This affects both api_jsonrpc.php and index.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-frontend-php - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-java-gateway - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-server-mysql - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 5.0.7+dfsg-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.7+dfsg-1build1').
